intro: Ilex × wandoensis, commonly known as the Wando holly, is a hybrid evergreen shrub or small tree native to the coastal regions of South Korea. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that remain throughout the year. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value. Due to its limited natural range, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
